programme.title: Killing Eve
programme.sub-title: I Don't Want to Be Free

programme.title: Rainha de Copas
programme.desc: Anne, uma bem-sucedida advogada, vive com as suas duas filhas e o marido Peter. Mas quando Gustav, o filho problemático de Peter de uma relação anterior, vai viver com eles, Anne cria uma relação íntima com o jovem, pondo em risco a sua vida perfeita.

programme.title: Um Dia Perfeito
programme.desc: Uma equipa de ajuda humanitária tenta resolver uma crise numa zona onde decorre um conflito armado. Humor, drama, emoção, rotina, perigo e esperança: tudo cabe num dia perfeito.

programme.title: A Barbearia
programme.desc: Calvin é um empresário com grandes planos para a sua vida, mas dirigir a barbearia da família não é um deles. Só que quando a vende de forma impulsiva a um obscuro negociante de empréstimos depressa se apercebe o quão importante é para si o seu salão de barbear e até onde irá para o recuperar.

programme.title: A Barbearia 2 - De Volta ao Negócio
programme.desc: Agora que Calvin já se habituou a gerir a barbearia da família, fundada pelo avô, os problemas não param de aparecer, principalmente quando abre em frente uma barbearia rival, pertencente a uma grande cadeia comercial, e que é muito mais moderna. Será possível competir?

programme.title: 11.6 - Desvio de Milhões
programme.desc: Um filme baseado na história verídica de Toni Musulin, motorista de uma carrinha de valores, que encenou um audacioso roubo, recorrendo à sua própria viatura de trabalho, que lhe valeu 11.6 milhões de euros, sem utilizar armas de fogo.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
Mentes Criminosas
programme.desc:
Criminal Minds: Created by Jeff Davis. With Matthew Gray Gubler, Kirsten Vangsness, A.J. Cook, Joe Mantegna. The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0452046/","name":"Criminal Minds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE2ZmFkZTYtNjRiOS00ZjE3LThjOWMtZTViZjRmNDFjNTQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strik","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452046/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccreech"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I like the content and the characterizations of "Criminal Minds."","reviewBody":"I have watched each episode of Criminal Minds, and I agree with the writer from Canada about this show (and also about their comments on NCIS, which seems to have more spark and humor than the other CSI shows).

Mandy Patinkin turns anything he's in to pure gold, and I hope "Criminal Minds" will get a long run! The plots are engaging, the cast interacts well together, and nobody comes off as being too "preachy," as you get with some of the CSIs and Law & Orders.

Thanks for the opportunity to support a fine show which is up against some tough competition. I watched "Lost" quite a bit it's first season, but finally got bored with it because it never seemed to have any resolution. Just episode upon episode of wondering why it wasn't going anywhere. In other words, "Lost" lost me! And I'm starting to get that same feeling with "Desperate Housewives," too. When I was a kid I really enjoyed ongoing serials; but not that much anymore.... 

Shows like Criminal Minds and Numbers and NCIS manage to make you think you've watched a complete story; and from my point of view, I respond to that kind of entertainment much, much better!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":179776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-09-22","keywords":"serial killer,serial murder,murder,21st century,2000s","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131557/","name":"Matthew Gray Gubler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494536/","name":"Kirsten Vangsness"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176882/","name":"A.J. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0452046/","name":"Criminal Minds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE2ZmFkZTYtNjRiOS00ZjE3LThjOWMtZTViZjRmNDFjNTQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strik","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452046/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccreech","dateCreated":"2005-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I like the content and the characterizations of "Criminal Minds."","reviewBody":"I have watched each episode of Criminal Minds, and I agree with the writer from Canada about this show (and also about their comments on NCIS, which seems to have more spark and humor than the other CSI shows).

Mandy Patinkin turns anything he's in to pure gold, and I hope "Criminal Minds" will get a long run! The plots are engaging, the cast interacts well together, and nobody comes off as being too "preachy," as you get with some of the CSIs and Law & Orders.

Thanks for the opportunity to support a fine show which is up against some tough competition. I watched "Lost" quite a bit it's first season, but finally got bored with it because it never seemed to have any resolution. Just episode upon episode of wondering why it wasn't going anywhere. In other words, "Lost" lost me! And I'm starting to get that same feeling with "Desperate Housewives," too. When I was a kid I really enjoyed ongoing serials; but not that much anymore.... 

Shows like Criminal Minds and Numbers and NCIS manage to make you think you've watched a complete story; and from my point of view, I respond to that kind of entertainment much, much better!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":179776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-09-22","keywords":"serial killer,serial murder,murder,21st century,2000s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131557/","name":"Matthew Gray Gubler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494536/","name":"Kirsten Vangsness","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176882/","name":"A.J. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strik","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452046/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccreech","dateCreated":"2005-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I like the content and the characterizations of "Criminal Minds."","reviewBody":"I have watched each episode of Criminal Minds, and I agree with the writer from Canada about this show (and also about their comments on NCIS, which seems to have more spark and humor than the other CSI shows).

Mandy Patinkin turns anything he's in to pure gold, and I hope "Criminal Minds" will get a long run! The plots are engaging, the cast interacts well together, and nobody comes off as being too "preachy," as you get with some of the CSIs and Law & Orders.

Thanks for the opportunity to support a fine show which is up against some tough competition. I watched "Lost" quite a bit it's first season, but finally got bored with it because it never seemed to have any resolution. Just episode upon episode of wondering why it wasn't going anywhere. In other words, "Lost" lost me! And I'm starting to get that same feeling with "Desperate Housewives," too. When I was a kid I really enjoyed ongoing serials; but not that much anymore.... 

Shows like Criminal Minds and Numbers and NCIS manage to make you think you've watched a complete story; and from my point of view, I respond to that kind of entertainment much, much better!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":179776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-09-22","keywords":"serial killer,serial murder,murder,21st century,2000s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131557/","name":"Matthew Gray Gubler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494536/","name":"Kirsten Vangsness","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176882/","name":"A.J. programme.title: S.W.A.T. - Força de Intervenção
programme.desc: Alex Montell, um traficante de droga, é transportado pela Polícia de Los Angeles e mantido em custódia federal. Mas tudo se complica quando o prisioneiro oferece 100 milhões de dólares a quem o libertar.

programme.title: Assalto a Londres
programme.desc: O funeral do primeiro-ministro britânico torna-se o evento mais protegido de sempre, mas também uma oportunidade para matar líderes poderosos. Apenas três pessoas o podem impedir: o presidente dos EUA, os Serviços Secretos americanos e um agente do MI6.

programme.title: Criminal Minds
Mentes Criminosas
programme.desc:
Criminal Minds: Created by Jeff Davis. With Matthew Gray Gubler, Kirsten Vangsness, A.J. Cook, Joe Mantegna. The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0452046/","name":"Criminal Minds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE2ZmFkZTYtNjRiOS00ZjE3LThjOWMtZTViZjRmNDFjNTQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strik","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452046/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ccreech"},"dateCreated":"2005-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I like the content and the characterizations of "Criminal Minds."","reviewBody":"I have watched each episode of Criminal Minds, and I agree with the writer from Canada about this show (and also about their comments on NCIS, which seems to have more spark and humor than the other CSI shows).

Mandy Patinkin turns anything he's in to pure gold, and I hope "Criminal Minds" will get a long run! The plots are engaging, the cast interacts well together, and nobody comes off as being too "preachy," as you get with some of the CSIs and Law & Orders.

Thanks for the opportunity to support a fine show which is up against some tough competition. I watched "Lost" quite a bit it's first season, but finally got bored with it because it never seemed to have any resolution. Just episode upon episode of wondering why it wasn't going anywhere. In other words, "Lost" lost me! And I'm starting to get that same feeling with "Desperate Housewives," too. When I was a kid I really enjoyed ongoing serials; but not that much anymore....

IMDb data; ttnr: 0452046, Title: Criminal Minds, --- Description: Criminal Minds: Created by Jeff Davis. With Matthew Gray Gubler, Kirsten Vangsness, A.J. Cook, Joe Mantegna. The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strike again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0452046/","name":"Criminal Minds","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGE2ZmFkZTYtNjRiOS00ZjE3LThjOWMtZTViZjRmNDFjNTQwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjg4NzAyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the F.B.I. Behavioral Analysis Unit (B.A.U.), an elite group of profilers who analyze the nation's most dangerous serial killers and individual heinous crimes in an effort to anticipate their next moves before they strik","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0452046/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ccreech","dateCreated":"2005-10-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"I like the content and the characterizations of "Criminal Minds."","reviewBody":"I have watched each episode of Criminal Minds, and I agree with the writer from Canada about this show (and also about their comments on NCIS, which seems to have more spark and humor than the other CSI shows).

Mandy Patinkin turns anything he's in to pure gold, and I hope "Criminal Minds" will get a long run! The plots are engaging, the cast interacts well together, and nobody comes off as being too "preachy," as you get with some of the CSIs and Law & Orders.

Thanks for the opportunity to support a fine show which is up against some tough competition. I watched "Lost" quite a bit it's first season, but finally got bored with it because it never seemed to have any resolution. Just episode upon episode of wondering why it wasn't going anywhere. In other words, "Lost" lost me! And I'm starting to get that same feeling with "Desperate Housewives," too. When I was a kid I really enjoyed ongoing serials; but not that much anymore.... 

Shows like Criminal Minds and Numbers and NCIS manage to make you think you've watched a complete story; and from my point of view, I respond to that kind of entertainment much, much better!","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":179776,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2005-09-22","keywords":"serial killer,serial murder,murder,21st century,2000s","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131557/","name":"Matthew Gray Gubler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494536/","name":"Kirsten Vangsness","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0176882/","name":"A.J. programme.title: Dredd
programme.desc: Numa cidade violenta e futurista, Dredd é o derradeiro juiz e está determinado a salvar a cidade do seu mais recente flagelo: uma perigosa droga, que permite aos seus utilizadores experimentarem a realidade numa fração da sua velocidade normal.

programme.title: Blade Runner 2049
programme.desc: K, um novo blade runner da Polícia de Los Angeles, desvenda um segredo há muito enterrado que pode mergulhar no caos o que resta da sociedade. Esta descoberta leva-o numa missão para localizar Rick Deckard, um antigo blade runner da Polícia de Los Angeles, desaparecido há 30 anos.

programme.title: Jonah Hex
programme.desc: No velho oeste, um caçador de recompensas esconde o seu bom coração por trás do seu rosto deformado e da sua personalidade forte. Mais uma vítima do terrível Quentin Turnbull, Hex, que deveria ter morrido num atentado contra a sua vida, ressuscitou.... com sede de vingança.

programme.title: Com a Casa às Costas
programme.desc: Em vez das prometidas férias no Havai, um pai de família californiano impõe aos seus familiares uma viagem ao Colorado a bordo de uma caravana.

programme.title: Uns Pais do Pior
programme.desc: Frank e Nancy levam a sua única filha à faculdade e quando regressam a casa, num bairro da classe alta, constatam que as suas poupanças diminuem rapidamente. Recorrem então a medidas extremas para esconder a sua situação e manter as aparências...

programme.title: O Sorriso das Estrelas
programme.desc: Numa estalagem, uma mãe de família, que se encontra em processo de divórcio, e um cirurgião, que acaba de sofrer, também ele, um grande trauma, apaixonam-se.

programme.title: A Decisão Mortal
programme.desc: Anna e Tom querem começar uma família, mas vivem dificuldades económicas. Até ao dia em que descobrem o seu inquilino morto e um saco cheio de dinheiro em casa dele. Ao guardar segredo e ficar com o dinheiro, o casal torna-se um alvo a abater.

programme.title: Livrai-nos do Mal
programme.desc: Sarchie, um oficial da Polícia de Nova Iorque, começa a investigar uma série de crimes perturbantes e inexplicáveis. Alia-se a um padre pouco convencional, experiente nos rituais do exorcismo, para combater as terríveis e demoníacas possessões que aterrorizam a sua cidade.

programme.title: Enquanto Somos Jovens
programme.desc: Josh e Cornelia formam um feliz casal de meia-idade, cuja vida se vai alterar depois de conhecerem Jamie e Darby, um jovem casal de espírito livre. Em pouco tempo, os quarentões colocam de parte os amigos da sua idade para seguirem estes jovens hipsters.

programme.title: A Teoria de Tudo
programme.desc: A extraordinária história de uma das mentes mais brilhantes dos nossos tempos, o astrofísico Stephen Hawking, e de duas pessoas que, por amor, desafiam todas as probabilidades. O filme é baseado nas memórias de Jane Hawking.

programme.title: DragonHeart: Coração de Dragão
programme.desc: Nos tempos antigos, quando majestosos respiradores de fogo sobrevoavam os céus, Bowen fica face a face e coração a coração com o último dragão na Terra, Draco. Enquanto tenta travar um rei tirano, Bowen percebe que a tarefa será mais difícil do que imaginou: se matar o rei, Draco também morrerá.

programme.title: Madame
programme.desc: Anne e Bob mudam-se para uma mansão em Paris e, quando preparam um luxuoso jantar de amigos, Anne apercebe-se que vão sentar-se 13 pessoas à mesa. Para evitar o número do azar, pede à sua leal criada Maria para se disfarçar de aristocrata espanhola...

programme.title: Payback - A Vingança
programme.desc: O assalto foi fácil e o dinheiro estava no papo. Mas ao dividir os lucros, Val cometeu três erros: levou o dinheiro e a mulher de Porter, e tentou acabar com a vida do parceiro. Agora, Porter quer o dinheiro de volta e não interessa como o consegue. E não vai parar enquanto não tiver a sua vingança.

programme.title: Predador 2
programme.desc: Vem de uma galáxia distante para caçar e deixa um rasto de cadáveres na sua passagem. Em estado de sítio devido a uma guerra entre gangues, Los Angeles é o campo de caça perfeito para o Predador. O tenente Mike Harrigan decide investigar e coloca-se frente a frente do enigmático alienígena.

programme.title: Assassinos Substitutos
programme.desc: A hesitação de um assassino a soldo em cumprir a missão de morte de que foi incumbido coloca-o na mira de implacáveis atiradores encarregues de o eliminar.

programme.title: Criminosos à Solta
programme.desc: Quatro homens, filhos de mafiosos de Brooklyn, juntam-se para recuperar um saco de dinheiro, que um deles deveria ter levado ao seu pai. Só que este foi apreendido pelo xerife corrupto de uma pequena cidade.

programme.title: Resgate
programme.desc: Um milionário proprietário de uma companhia de aviação descobre que o seu filho, de nove anos, foi sequestrado e pedem-lhe um resgate de dois milhões de dólares. Inicialmente prontifica-se a pagar o resgate, mas quando conclui que vão matar o seu filho após o pagamento, decide reverter o jogo.

programme.title: Minorca
programme.desc: Depois de esconder um diamante roubado no saco de uma mulher, Calvin, que mais do que anão tem o tamanho de um bebé, deve infiltrar-se na casa dela para o reaver.

programme.title: Perigo em Directo
programme.desc: Alvin Sanders não percebe como a sua condenação por furto foi limpa do seu cadastro ou por que lhe são entregues mais de 11 mil dólares. Este ex-presidiário vai ser usado pela polícia para capturar um assassino.

programme.title: Torque - A Lei do Mais Rápido
programme.desc: As motas são a vida de Cary Ford, mas agora podem ser a sua morte! O gangue "Os Reapers" persegue-o por um crime que não cometeu. Já o líder dos rivais "Hellions" quer apanhá-lo, bem como ao contrabando que julga que Ford lhe roubou. E também o FBI tem uma palavra a dizer...

programme.title: Engana-me Que Eu Gosto
programme.desc: Danny, solteiro e um cirurgião plástico bem-sucedido, usa um estratagema de engate muito pouco convencional: diz que é casado, evitando assim envolvimentos mais profundos. Isto até se apaixonar por Palmer. No entanto, infelizmente, a rapariga julga que ele é casado.

programme.title: Com a Casa às Costas
programme.desc: Em vez das prometidas férias no Havai, um pai de família californiano impõe aos seus familiares uma viagem ao Colorado a bordo de uma caravana.

programme.title: Uns Pais do Pior
programme.desc: Frank e Nancy levam a sua única filha à faculdade e quando regressam a casa, num bairro da classe alta, constatam que as suas poupanças diminuem rapidamente. Recorrem então a medidas extremas para esconder a sua situação e manter as aparências...

programme.title: O Estranho Caso de Benjamin Button
programme.desc: Às portas da morte, Daisy pede à filha para ler, em voz alta, o diário de Benjamin Button. O velho amigo de Daisy relata a sua vida extraordinária, marcada irremediavelmente pelo facto bizarro de ter nascido já octogenário. Ao contrário do habitual, Benjamin vai rejuvenescendo com o passar dos anos.

programme.title: Resgate
programme.desc: Um milionário proprietário de uma companhia de aviação descobre que o seu filho, de nove anos, foi sequestrado e pedem-lhe um resgate de dois milhões de dólares. Inicialmente prontifica-se a pagar o resgate, mas quando conclui que vão matar o seu filho após o pagamento, decide reverter o jogo.

programme.title: Escobar: Paraíso Perdido
programme.desc: Nick pensa ter encontrado o paraíso na Colômbia, onde se apaixona pela bela Maria. Tudo parece perfeito até que Maria lhe apresenta o tio: Pablo Escobar. No início, Nick deixa-se seduzir pela sua aura, mas, aos poucos, o sonho transforma-se em pesadelo.

programme.title: Combate Mortal 2
programme.desc: O governador do Espaço Exterior envia um grupo de Exterminadores à conquista da Terra, onde um conjunto de guerreiros tenta impedir os seus planos.

programme.title: Os Irmãos Sisters
programme.desc: No velho oeste, dois irmãos, Charlie e Eli Sisters, são contratados para matar um prospetor de ouro. Começa assim uma implacável caçada, mas também uma jornada que irá testar os laços entre os dois irmãos.

programme.title: Força Anti-Crime
programme.desc: Los Angeles, 1949. Mickey Cohen, um impiedoso gangster, tem a cidade na sua mão. Contra um gangue protegido pela crescente corrupção, Bill Parker recruta o sargento John O'Mara, reunindo uma unidade especial para repor a justiça. As ordens não são para prender criminosos, mas sim iniciar uma guerra.

programme.title: Predadores
programme.desc: Selecionado pela sua aptidão para matar sem escrúpulos, um grupo é deixado no meio de uma selva, algures perdida no Universo. Os predadores humanos são agora sistematicamente perseguidos e eliminados por uma nova espécie de predadores alienígenas.

programme.title: Dizem Por Aí...
programme.desc: Sarah Huttinger concordou em casar, mas está apavorada com a ideia. A sua carreira de jornalista estagnou na página de obituário do New York Times. A sua irmã Annie decidiu casar-se com o parceiro de ténis e Sarah vai ter que assistir ao enlace, o que significa passar tempo com a sua família...

programme.title: The Night Shift: Turno da Noite
The Night Shift: Turno da Noite
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.sub-title: Le Chien Est Le Meilleur Ami de L'Homme
programme.desc:
Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: A Minha Namorada Tem Amnésia
programme.desc: Henry Roth, um biólogo marinho do Havai, encontra todas as desculpas para não se comprometer com as mulheres com quem sai. No entanto, ao conhecer a mulher dos seus sonhos, a encantadora Lucy Whitmore, descobre também um problema para a relação: quando Lucy se levanta de manhã, perde a memória.

programme.title: Murder, She Baked: O Mistério das Bolachas
programme.desc: Depois de descobrir o corpo do seu amigo e empregado nas traseiras da sua loja, uma pasteleira, numa pequena cidade do Minnesota, torna-se uma detetive amadora.

programme.title: Murder, She Baked: O Mistério do Pudim de Ameixa
programme.desc: A pasteleira Hannah Swensen está a ganhar fama, depois de descobrir mais um cadáver na calma cidade de Eden Lake. Os suspeitos do crime acumulam-se de uma forma surpreendente, graças às investigações informais de Hannah, que não agradam muito à polícia.

Candice Renoir

programme.desc:
Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Her daily routine ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter"},"dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 2819924, Title: Candice Renoir, --- Description: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter","dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Pascal Lahmani, Nicolas Picard-Dreyfuss, Stéphane Malhuret, Olivier Barma, Raphaël Lenglet

programme.title: Jogo Sujo
programme.desc: Quando Dodge Connolly, resolve recrutar o herói de guerra Carter "The Bullet" Rutherford para ajudar a sua fraca equipa. Com a chegada de Carter, chega também a inteligente e insolente jornalista Lexie Littleton que foi incumbida pelo seu editor da tarefa de descobrir os podres de Carter.

programme.title: Esse Jogo É para Três
programme.desc: Shante Smith é especialista em relacionamentos e usa os seus conhecimentos da mente masculina para ajudar as mulheres a conseguirem o que querem.

programme.title: Páscoa Infiltrada
programme.desc: Erin Cavendish infiltra-se na fábrica de chocolate da família para ver porque é que as vendas baixaram, e lá conhece o chefe chocolateiro Bryan, que tem ideias para inovar a linha de produtos para a Páscoa.

IMDb data; ttnr: 2819924, Title: Candice Renoir, --- Description: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter","dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Pascal Lahmani, Nicolas Picard-Dreyfuss, Stéphane Malhuret, Olivier Barma, Raphaël Lenglet

programme.title: O Sorriso de Mona Lisa
programme.desc: Em 1953, uma professora de História da Arte num colégio para raparigas tenta alargar os estreitos horizontes das suas brilhantes alunas. O maior desafio será fazer com que as estudantes encontrem (e assumam) a sua identidade cultural, partindo da visão ampla e desafiante dos novos conhecimentos.

programme.title: Murder, She Baked: O Mistério do Pudim de Ameixa
programme.desc: A pasteleira Hannah Swensen está a ganhar fama, depois de descobrir mais um cadáver na calma cidade de Eden Lake. Os suspeitos do crime acumulam-se de uma forma surpreendente, graças às investigações informais de Hannah, que não agradam muito à polícia.

programme.title: Murder, She Baked: O Mistério da Tarte de Pêssego
programme.desc: Hannah mergulha mais uma vez num mistério que envolve um assassinato ao encontrar o cadáver de um concorrente seu. Mas desta vez é ela que é acusada de homicídio por causa de uma torta de pêssego.

IMDb data; ttnr: 2819924, Title: Candice Renoir, --- Description: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine ","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2819924/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Doctor_Dexter","dateCreated":"2016-06-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"The female sitcom-detective cliché","reviewBody":"Over the last decades, in Europe, we've been swamped with the older female detective character with a family in tow. Some have a weak excuse for a husband to emphasise their strength, many others are independent single mothers who struggle with a demanding job and raising their kids. To be honest, I'm not a fan of the genre. Nothing against strong and independent women, au contraire. I just prefer decent detective work above being sucked into the personal life of a fictional character. If I wanted to see family drama I'd go watch a sitcom. It's beyond me why the detective genre has to be muddled with sitcom-esque fluff like this. (I wouldn't buy it, but it's programmed on TV *instead* of a proper detective). I can accept a modest degree of family life. After all, Beck and Wallander have families too. However, they are primarily detectives, and every episode is about solving the case. 

"Candice Renoir" is more sitcom than detectives. And it's just as tacky and kitschy as the name already suggests. A fifty-something big mama, who seems to think she's Brigitte Bardot in the seventies, miraculously becomes the team leader of a small town detective team. She blunders through everything, but 'magically' finds clues in fashion magazines and the likes. She's supposed to portray the strong and independent older woman who can do it all, kids and playing the boss- detective, but it's way to contrived to be the least bit believable. Her character, the rainbow team, the younger cutesy neighbour - who has stamped "love interest" in all caps across his handsome forehead - it's all a stylised light version of a concept we've seen many, many times before. And now it's here again, only worse. Yay. 

To be fair, the acting of the team and other characters varies from passable to decent, but the lead actress is really milking the diva character, and as such, overacting horribly in just about every scene.

It might just about do as daytime TV, on a rainy afternoon, but that's probably me being generous.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1103,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-G","genre":["Comedy","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2013-04-19","keywords":"france,female police officer,police","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0092291/","name":"Cécile Bois","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0501845/","name":"Raphaël Lenglet","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6511436/","name":"Clara Antoons"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011107/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0053077/","name":"Robin Barataud","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0043904/","name":"Brigitte Peskine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2784794/","name":"Solen Roy-Pagenault"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Promo Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2892283161","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2FhNWFlYmItYmE5My00ZmM0LThlZDctZGE5YjhiMThkZDQ1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""</script><metacontent=" --- Director: Pascal Lahmani, Nicolas Picard-Dreyfuss, Stéphane Malhuret, Olivier Barma, Raphaël Lenglet

programme.title: Uma Noite Com o Presidente
programme.desc: Andrew Shepherd é Presidente dos EUA e apaixona-se por uma ecologista de um grupo de pressão, que é uma intrigante política a favor do ambiente. À medida que o romance progride, a popularidade de Andrew começa a cair.

programme.title: Guns Akimbo
programme.desc: A vida de Miles fica virada do avesso quando a namorada é raptada. Para salvá-la, ele terá de jogar um jogo que obriga estranhos a lutar até à morte, numa transmissão ao vivo para o público fanático de todo o mundo.

programme.title: Underworld: Evolução
programme.desc: Selene, uma guerreira vampira, combate um poderoso congénere que decide aliar-se ao seu irmão lobisomem para dominar o mundo das criaturas da noite.

programme.title: O Último Viking
programme.desc: Um jovem viking chamado Vitharr chega à Britânia com sonhos de conquistas e aventuras, mas quando a sua família e o seu clã são emboscados e mortos, ele tem de sobreviver sozinho nesta terra estranha e perigosa.

programme.title: Asher: Redenção de um Hitman
programme.desc: Asher é um hitman envelhecido que passou a maior parte da vida a eliminar outras vidas. Num último trabalho que não corre bem, Asher é confrontado com a realidade e tem que se redimir: para ser o homem que deseja ser, tem de eliminar o homem que foi.

programme.title: Diários de Che Guevara
programme.desc: Ernesto Che Guevara e o seu amigo Alberto Granado partem para uma viagem de 8000 quilómetros numa velha moto, carinhosamente apelidada de "La Poderosa". Che era, em 1952, um jovem de classe social abastada a um passo de terminar o curso de medicina, mas a realidade da América Latina muda a sua vida.

programme.title: A Poeira do Tempo
programme.desc: Em Los Angeles, em 1933, Camilla é uma mexicana que espera subir de vida casando com um americano rico, e Arturo um aspirante a escritor que sonha apaixonar-se por uma loura e escrever uma obra-prima em redor disso. Mas quando se conhecem, todos os seus planos vão levar uma reviravolta.

programme.title: Perfume de Mulher
programme.desc: Charlie aceita tomar conta de Frank Slade, um herói de guerra cego. Os dois viajam para Nova Iorque, com Frank em busca de um fim de semana inesquecível antes de morrer. Na viagem, este começa a interessar-se pelos problemas do jovem.

programme.title: O Clube
programme.desc: Cinco estudantes de liceu, todos completamente diferentes entre si, encontram-se de castigo na biblioteca da escola no sábado de manhã. Só que se no início nada têm a dizer uns aos outros, ao longo do dia acabam por perceber que têm muito mais em comum que aquilo que imaginavam.

programme.title: Equipa Mortal
programme.desc: Melvin Smiley é um assassino neurótico e absolutamente banal que trabalha para dois chefes criminosos. Um deles propõe ao stressado Melvin que rapte Keiko, a filha mais nova de um abastado industrial japonês, sem saber que ela é a afilhada do outro.

programme.title: Eles Vivem
programme.desc: Um solitário desempregado descobre que a sociedade está a ser dominada por uma raça superior de alienígenas, que se disfarçam de seres humanos. Como tal, vai juntar-se a uma organização que quer destruir os extraterrestres, mas estes só podem ser vistos com uns óculos de sol especiais.

programme.title: Terapia Para Casais
programme.desc: Quatro casais viajam para o Hotel Eden, um paraíso numa ilha tropical e especializado em terapia de casais. Um dos casais pretende resolver os seus problemas, mas os outros só se querem divertir. Mas não demoram a descobrir que a oferta de grupo tem um preço e que todos têm de participar na terapia!

programme.title: Diário de uma Nanny
programme.desc: Recém-licenciada, Annie é pressionada pela mãe para arranjar trabalho no mundo dos negócios. Annie começa a trabalhar como ama de uma família rica e vai ter de aturar todos os caprichos da mãe e do filho, e evitar o pai. Tudo se torna ainda mais complicado quando se apaixona pelo vizinho!

programme.title: Snatch - Porcos e Diamantes
programme.desc: Promotores de boxe sem escrúpulos, agentes violentos, um gangster russo, ladrões incompetentes, supostos judeus joalheiros, um cigano muito colorido e um cão... todos lutam para encontrar um diamante roubado, no bairro judeu de Londres.

programme.title: Lar Doce Inferno
programme.desc: Don Champagne é um homem de negócios bem-sucedido e casado com uma mulher bipolar, Mona, que também sofre de transtorno obsessivo-compulsivo. Mas quando Don se envolve com uma atraente colega de trabalho, o caso gera consequências inimagináveis para o casal.

programme.title: Para Lá da Fronteira
programme.desc: Um grupo de imigrantes de diversas nacionalidades luta para passar a fronteira dos Estados Unidos em busca de uma vida melhor.

programme.title: T-34
programme.desc: Em 1944, o comandante russo Nikolai Ivushkin, que está há três anos prisioneiro dos nazis, lidera um grupo corajoso de soldados e prepara uma audaciosa fuga ao cativeiro alemão num tanque T-34 meio destruído.

programme.title: O Culpado
programme.desc: Asger Holm, operador de central de emergências, atende a chamada de uma mulher raptada. Mas quando o telefonema é subitamente interrompido, Asger inicia uma corrida contra o tempo para salvar esta mulher de uma situação que pode ser mais complexa...

programme.title: O Viajante Nu
programme.desc: Abandonado pela namorada, o desolado Jake caminha nu pela costa da Austrália Ocidental para angariar dinheiro para a caridade e na esperança de que o seu gesto reconquiste a antiga amada. Mas pelo caminho conhece outra viajante, a lindíssima Valerie.

programme.title: O Jantar
programme.desc: Dois casais reúnem-se num restaurante de luxo para decidir o que fazer em relação a um crime que os filhos de ambos cometeram: deixá-los sofrer as consequências e passar por um sistema penal que os marcará para sempre ou fechar os olhos e validar um comportamento inaceitável?

programme.title: Horas
programme.desc: O furacão Katrina obriga Nolan Hayes e a sua filha prematura, ligada a um ventilador, a desesperar pela chegada da ambulância que os vai transferir. Mas ninguém regressa e ele vê-se obrigado a tomar decisões drásticas para manter a filha viva.

programme.title: A Vingança de Wyatt Earp
programme.desc: Um filme baseado na história real do lendário Xerife Earp. Conta como reuniu os melhores homens do Oeste para vingar o cruel assassinato da sua amada Dora.

programme.title: Terapia Para Casais
programme.desc: Quatro casais viajam para o Hotel Eden, um paraíso numa ilha tropical e especializado em terapia de casais. Um dos casais pretende resolver os seus problemas, mas os outros só se querem divertir. Mas não demoram a descobrir que a oferta de grupo tem um preço e que todos têm de participar na terapia!

programme.title: XXX2: Estado Radical
programme.desc: Quando o agente Gibbons, da NSA, descobre uma célula terrorista com ligações ao exército americano, que pretende assassinar o presidente dos Estados Unidos, sabe que não pode confiar em ninguém. Recruta então Darius Stone, um ex-militar a cumprir pena numa prisão de alta segurança...

programme.title: BlacKkKlansman - O Infiltrado
programme.desc: Ron Stallworth é o primeiro detetive afro-americano da Polícia de Colorado Springs, mas a sua chegada é vista com ceticismo e alguma hostilidade. No entanto, quando surge uma oportunidade, Stallworth decide entrar numa perigosa missão: infiltrar-se e expor o Ku Klux Klan...

programme.title: O Herói
programme.desc: Vitório regressa da guerra. Uma guerra que durou quase três décadas, na qual entrou forçado, aos 15 anos, como soldado raso. Vitório matou gente, viu os amigos morrerem, passou fome, pisou uma mina e perdeu uma perna. Após uma lenta recuperação, Vitório tenta a sua sorte nas ruas de Luanda.

programme.title: Tripla Ameaça
programme.desc: Três mercenários caídos em desgraça terão de liquidar um grupo de assassinos profissionais antes que estes alcancem o seu alvo, a filha de um bilionário...

programme.title: CSI: Miami
CSI: Miami
programme.sub-title: And How Does That Make You Kill?
programme.desc: CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
Investigação Criminal: New Orleans
programme.desc:
NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216"},"dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"}}</script><metacontent="

Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. IMDb data; ttnr: 3560084, Title: NCIS: New Orleans, --- Description: NCIS: New Orleans: Created by Gary Glasberg. With Scott Bakula, Rob Kerkovich, CCH Pounder, Daryl Mitchell. Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3560084/","name":"NCIS: New Orleans","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM3OTk1NTQyNF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjU4NDQwMDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Follows an NCIS team that investigates criminal cases involving military personnel in The Big Easy, a city known for its music, entertainment, and decadence.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3560084/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"elainecalloway216","dateCreated":"2014-04-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Might be a good spin off","reviewBody":"I grew up in New Orleans and I'm an avid NCIS fan, so I was interested to see how they would handle the Crescent City episodes. Overall, I think it did really well. 8 points out of 10.

A few things: 1. In episode 1, there were a few mistakes that those people who are locals could easily notice. A little bit more research would've been better, but the plot/characters/etc. was good.

2. Bakula's ongoing "my brother, my brother" is too much. People in NOLA don't do that, if anything they say "cher" as an affectionate term for friend, so it seemed overdone on the show.

3. A little bit hard to believe in part 2, that a woman would leave a bar to walk in a dark alley alone with someone she had just met. No local would ever do that. 

4. I liked part 2 much more than part 1, because they focused more on places the locals go to and not just the "tourist top 10 spots" like in episode 1. I also loved how they talked about the city and it gets into your DNA. Great and well scripted.

5. Love the actors and think it could be a great series going forward :)","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":16860,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-09-23","keywords":"usa,united states,investigation,naval officer,u.s. navy","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000836/","name":"Scott Bakula","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1827376/","name":"Rob Kerkovich","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001634/","name":"CCH Pounder"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0373192/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0113138/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0274041/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0321782/","name":"Gary Glasberg"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"NCIS: New Orleans: The Fourth Season","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1485290009","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkZDYwZjEtMWNlZi00Zjg5LWJhYjktYmY0NzY0ODM2NjM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRoaXJkLXBhcnR5LXZpZGVvLXVwZGF0ZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Promo"</script><metacontent=" --- Director: James Hayman, James Whitmore Jr., Michael Zinberg, Tony Wharmby, Mary Lou Belli

CSI: Miami
programme.desc: CSI: Miami: Created by Ann Donahue, Carol Mendelsohn, Anthony E. Zuiker. With David Caruso, Emily Procter, Adam Rodriguez, Rex Linn. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. How 'bout letting the other CSI Vogue characters have a little spotlight?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. How 'bout letting the other CSI Vogue characters have a little spotlight?"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55488,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2002-09-23","keywords":"place name in title,city name in title,city in title,united states of america,usa","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000325/","name":"David Caruso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0698346/","name":"Emily Procter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0735226/","name":"Adam Rodriguez"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0231929/","name":"Ann Donahue"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578856/","name":"Carol Mendelsohn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack"},"dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains. The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0313043/","name":"CSI: Miami","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTU3ZTI5ZGEtYjhiMy00ODU4LTgyM2UtNDhlYjBhMjc4MjIwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTYzMDM0NTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Miami-Dade, Florida police department's Crime Scene Investigations unit.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0313043/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"shaypack","dateCreated":"2005-11-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"Change the name to CSI: Vogue","reviewBody":"One person ruins this show: David Caruso. All he does is pose. They should make it into a drinking game. Every time he strikes a pose, take a shot. Of course, people have died from alcohol poisoning. This would only add to the statistics. All the other characters have depth. He just gets this look on his face and 'strikes a pose'. Watch him turn sideways and look over his shoulder. Wow!! OOOhhh, he figured out something. Time for him to take off his sunglasses. I challenge any of you to find an episode where he isn't positioned sideways looking over his shoulder and where he takes off his sunglasses. Quit posing and pretend like you know how to act!!!!\n\nAnd, how come he has to figure everything out? The other shows let the other characters show some brains.
